business days to meet all contact requirements. DITA examiners are responsible for ensuring interim letters are issued, as required. Refer to IRM

, General IDTVA Letter Procedures, for speciﬁc instructions. DITA examiners are responsible for completing the corrective adjustments remove transactions/assessments related to the identity theft incident from impacted accounts. The referring functions are responsible for making the theft determination prior to referring the adjustment request. DITA will not review the determinations made by the referring function for accuracy. DITA employees may identify the ID theft referral was incomplete. DITA will contact the referring operation and request that the missing information be provided or corrected. If DITA is unable to obtain the necessary then the referral will be rejected through CIS back to the referring number. The DITA liaison will document the request for information in a CIS Case Note.
